body:

I hit the same panic in the current nightly: `rustc 1.0.0-nightly (170c4399e 2015-01-14 00:41:55 +0000)`

``` rust
trait Vec3d {
    fn cross<V>(&self, rhs: &V)  
        where V: Vec3d,
              Mul<<Self as Index<usize>>::Output>::Output: Float { } 
}
```

I just got this error too. I was running `cargo build` at the time of the bug. I pushed up my code in its exact state when the bug occured: https://github.com/dcuddeback/rust-bug/tree/3c11b1a5cddb7cdfc9021e75814a833bd455e902

My most recent change before triggering the bug is that I changed the `Error` type in the `Encodable` implementation here: https://github.com/dcuddeback/rust-bug/blob/3c11b1a5cddb7cdfc9021e75814a833bd455e902/src/command.rs#L21 I was previously getting an error message that it expected `Error` to be an associated type, so I changed it from `std::error::Error` to `Encoder::Error`. Come to think of it, that should be `S::Error`.

``` rust
fn f(a : Iterator) where Iterator::Item : std::fmt::String
{
}

fn main()
{
}

```

I get the same error with this one-line file:

```
type T = Iterator::Item;
```

Debian user.

Wow!  I think we have a repro-golf winner. :) 

(that does repro on play: http://is.gd/G0Q5OA)

Also hitting this one on the latest nightly:

`rustc 1.0.0-nightly (1d00c545e 2015-01-30 19:56:34 +0000)`
